content:
High in the mountains, with cold wind chafing my cheeks, I made a vow to myself under the quiet gaze of an ancient pine. The world was below me, a patchwork of valleys and rivers, and I could hear my heart echoing back from the rocks.

It was there that determination crystallized—each gust of wind carrying away old fears, each stone underfoot grounding me in the knowledge that I was capable of scaling more than just mountains.
